pr_title: DHFPROD-4379: Adding library for encapsulating ES logic

timeline.bodyText: This is the only change to existing code, as it was a trivial refactoring to perform.
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText:
This still has the issue of not working if the EntityTypeTitle has a slash in it - which seems very unlikely. There's a test to verify that it fails.
@ryanjdew you had mentioned grabbing the model doc and figuring the baseUri from that. I'd like for this method to not avoid any DB calls though - in fact, I have a convention of "find" implying the need to query ML, and "get" not involving any queries (I've used that convention in the past, it's a handy way for a client to know how performant a function should be).
timeline.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText: Since we always have baseUrl, the length should be 5 after split with "/"
timeline.author: hao1st

replies.author: hao1st

replies.bodyText: The problem is ES doesn't require a particular format for baseUri. ES will accept this too: "something/title-version/title". So the minimum length we can support is 3, which then assumes that the second token contains the model title and version.
replies.author: rjrudin

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                version: infoTokens.slice(1).join("-"),
          
          
            
                version: infoTokens.slice(1)[0],
timeline.author: hao1st

replies.bodyText: The "join" is needed to support a version like "1.0-SNAPSHOT" - see the test for that.
replies.author: rjrudin

timeline.author: hao1st

replies.bodyText: I didn't yet because it's not an exported function. We also don't have any expectation of comments on methods - the vast majority of DH functions don't have comments. I only included them where I felt they added value in this library, and I didn't think they did for getModelId, which is simple enough to understand by looking at the code.
replies.author: rjrudin

timeline.message:
DHFPROD-4379: Adding library for encapsulating ES logic

Only modification to existing code is for the entity-services mapper to use this library. We can gradually refactor other areas of DHF to use the functions in here, and of course this library can be enhanced over time.
